This selective media coverage can create a skewed perception of societal progress.
A2 (values-focused ethicist): While society has seen measurable improvements in areas like healthcare and education, these gains do not negate meaningful declines in social cohesion, mental health, and moral values. Older generations' perception of societal decline is not merely a product of media bias, but is also rooted in observable changes in community trust, rising mental health crises, and shifting moral frameworks that prioritize individualism over collective well-being. These trends are supported by sociological research and longitudinal studies that show a divergence between material progress and social well-being.
